result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Allen Curry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.   Bond applied remaining balance to be paid on a schedule established by the agent .
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
